Text.Value: Look. See. The crowd - they laugh. They shine with innocence. But it is a lie.

EditorData.AnimationTags: Displacer Beast nods towards the crowd
displacer beast idling while looking away
EditorData.SFXTags: [DP] Not as powerful as the roar, but still a warning to the player to back off

Text.Value: *The beast ignores you, her eyes locked on the crowd.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: displacer beast looks in the direction of the crowd
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: the beast is NOT looking at player, she's looking away in the direction of the crowd

Text.Value: My kills. My prey. You took them. Run. I'll find you. Eat you. COWARD.
*While the cage is sturdy, the lock is old. It could be jammed shut - so not even a key could open it.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player inspect the cage. Reusing animation.

Text.Value: First in what? Come on - your secret is safe with me.
When exactly do you plan on killing everyone?
Break the lock with a well-time jab.
Break the lock, ensuring the cage can't be opened.
Show me what? Come on - your secret is safe with me.
Mock me. Tease me. You will be the first.
*Teeth bared, she promises claws in your gut, and fangs on your throat.*
Slip an old, broken lockpick into the keyhole, jamming the lock shut.
Break the lock, trapping the beast within.

EditorData.SFXTags: [DP] Deep, gutteral roar, powerful and aggressive

Text.Value: My time comes. I will show you. All of you.
I thought you a hunter. Wrong. You're prey - small. Snivelling. Pathetic.
Poor creature - locked in a cage, denied her true nature. Civilisation would call her a monstrosity, yet it treats her like this...?

EditorData.NodeContext: Saddened/outraged at a caged creature's plight

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player inspect the cage. Reusing animation.

Text.Value: Make a noise, trying to catch her attention.
I roar. Break my cage - and then you die. You all die.
*You see a tidal wave of hate and violence in her eyes, before she turns away.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: displacer beast turns to look at player, then back at the crowd
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Turns to look at player, then turns back to the crowd. Player claps hands or make a noise. Reusing animation.

Text.Value: Murder whoever you want. I'll be long gone.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Give a punch to the cage. Reuse.
EditorData.SFXTags: [DP] Player hitting the metal cage, lock jamming shut

Text.Value: Check if the cage's lock is secure.
Every one of you is vicious. Cruel. You kill my mate. Steal my cubs.

EditorData.SFXTags: [DP] Deep, gutteral roar, powerful and aggressive

Text.Value: *She will attack, and kill, at the first opportunity.*
Tell me what you're up to or I set this cage on fire.

EditorData.SFXTags: [DP] Less aggressive than the growl, but still threatening/intimidating

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Give a punch to the cage. Reuse.

Synopsis: Shadow the displacer beast is one of the animals who will participate in the doppelganger-dribbles attack. Player can try (and fail) to calm her, and realise the only way to stop her is to break the cage lock and trap her.
